data.name: Attack on Veracruz
data.desc: Laurens de Graaf, Nicholas van Hoorn and Michel de Grammont sack and ransom Veracruz
data.locn: Roatan, Veracruz, Isla de Sacrificios, Isla Mujeres
data.agents_sp: Gov Luis Bartolomé de Córdova y Zúñiga, Adm Diego Fernández de Zaldívar, John Murphy, Mateo Alonso de Huidobro, Pedro Estrada
data.agents_nsp0: Laurens de Graaf, Lt Michiel Andrieszoon, Nicholas van Hoorn, Michel de Grammont, Jacob Hall, Jean Toccard 5 Ships 8 Sloops c 1300 men
data.note:
1682 Hon [Sp Hon?] Fr Capt Blot and Capt Jan 'Jantje' Willems sail to Honduras fm Cayman Islands in order to join 1683 Attack on Veracruz /v Marley P 1 49
 Feb 1683 Petit-Goâve. Fr Gov grants letter of reprisal against Sp to Capt Nikolaas van Hoorn, who sails with Sieur de Grammont towards Central America [Hon?] to find Capt Graaf and Michiel Andrieszoon who were reputedly lying there with 'two great ships, a bark, a sloop ... and 500 men' / [missg] [Bay of Honduras] 2 large Sp merchantmen, Nuestra Señora de Consolación and Nuestra Señora de Regla, seized by Capt Graaf aboard his flagship Francesa; Capt Hoorn seizes 2 unladen [Sp] vessels, and disembarks [in Sp Hon] in search of indigo being brought to port / 7 Apr 1683 Roatan. Capt Graaf holds huge gathering of pirates, inc Capts Grammont and Hoorn, to propose assault against Veracruz; pirates agree, after which Capt Graaf sails northwards in Nuestra Señora de Regla and 1 other Sp prize [of Jan Willems], followed by fleet of 3 Ships 8 Sloops / 17 May-mid Jun 1683 Veracruz. Buccaneers take Veracruz, ransack it for 4 days, torture vars residents and move them to Isla de Sacrificios [where Graaf duels Hoorn], demand ransom for Veracruz fm Mexico City, which is received [= or in addition to 1,500 slaves], when Adm Diego Fernández de Zaldívar sights but does not pursue them / Late Jun 1683 Isla Mujeres. Buccaneers partition booty and go their separate ways /v Marley P 1 100-101
 See David F. Marley, *Sack of Veracruz: The Great Pirate Raid of 1683* [Windsor, Ont. Netherlandic Press, 1993]
 Possibly see 1683 Bodegas del Golfo Dulce, and Verapaz via Río Polochic raided or attacked by Dutch pirate Juan Zanques /v Lujan 2 108
 Amsterdam den 13 Augustus. Van Curassouw heeft men bericht, dat den befaemden Rover van Hoorn sigh met verscheyde Schepen in Zee onthielt; men meent, dat hy wel 1000 Man by sigh hadde: hy heeft verovert een Schip van de Honduras, en een Petache. /Oprechte Haerlemsche Courant no 33 [14 Aug 1683] p 2 [https://resolver.kb.nl/resolve?urn=ddd:011224901:mpeg21:a0006]
 Possibly see St. Malo den 18 Augusti. Op het advys, dat de Zee-Rovers in West-Indien de Schepen, van de Honduras komende, hebben geattacqueert, segt men, sal onsen Koning eenige Oorlog-schepen derwaerts senden, omme gemelde Rovers, soo veel mogelijck is, te dempen. /Oprechte Haerlemsche Courant no 35 [2 Sep 1683] p 1 [https://resolver.kb.nl/resolve?urn=ddd:011224914:mpeg21:a0001]
 Possibly see 1683-1684. Capt Jeremy Rendell of Jam in Hond Bay decide to head to Camp, but John Graham and most crew decline to follow, leaving Capt marooned 'upon an island, giving them a turtle net and a canoe with their arms to shift for themselves, the said island not being inhabited and about 10 leagues from the main or any other inhabited place' /v Cordingly cap 7 /CO 1/57, f 381
 Nov 1683 - 1685. Lorencillo [Laurent de Graft] sacks Cartagena, then heads to Hond, where colleauges sack Pto Caballos /v Salmoral 222
